column4: I dont have any issues with wallpaper and twniview... clarify to the channel what you are trying todo.
well, I'm actually running fluxbox, which uses fbsetbg (which uses Esetroot) to set the background.
you mean set a sepetrate wallpaper for each head? or what exactly? Perzonally i just make my own custome 'very wide' wallpapers of the proper sizes to cover both monitors with seperate 'images'
gnome does NOT have the feature to set a seperate wallpaper for each display. kde does.
I have the impression that after running Esetroot my automatic screen turn-off on timeout has stopped, also!
alt-ctrl-bs has been 'removed' use alt-sysreq-k now a days
pressing SysReq triggers the print screen application.
thats because you need a shift also :)
what desktop are you running?
ive noticed that if i run 'nautilus --no-desktop' under icewm or other window managers - nautilus can do the automounting
not sure of other ways to get it going. :)
its part of some gnoem serveices  i recall.
do you know of a description of how Linux automounting works?  It seems both tangled and in constant flux at the moment!
theres dozens of automounting things that have poped up over the years. gnomes way is thelatest in a long line of them
there is no 'linux' automounting. :) its just yet another service you use on linux
Trust me - you do not want to go  back to the old old old ways. :)
i cant recall either. :) HAL id being replaced by somthing else now
at least they fixed the bug where you could actually make your initial user be named 'root' wich was proberly what he would of used.. if he was able to. :)
that low end a box.. well.. dont expect miracles. :)
your mention of nvidia-settings reminds me: does the Nvidia driver *still* not properly understand xrandr?
ive never noticed the issue.
when I run xrandr it only shows the compound desktop size: 3200x1200, no option for resizing or enabling individual screens from the command line
thats where twinview asnd xrandr are fighting I guess.
